TopicTitle: [1.0.x] Procedural Parts Textures | Procedural KW - June 8

Articles.Content:
The file is called FairingTex.rar

Oh you're right the fairings are in .rar, my bad. But still is it so hard to get yourself a program like WinRar or 7zip to extract it ?
Wow I forgot to put it in a zip. lol
no problem:kiss: just let me know when its in a zip please:sticktongue:
Zipped. I hope you don't encounter problems. Have Fun!
Thank you for your quick response Blackheart, and I just want to say I love your work:kiss:

Thank you for your quick response Blackheart, and I just want to say I love your work:kiss:

No problem, thank you.
what's about structural versions of the KW fairings for the interstage adapters?
What do you mean?
without the detach function
Oh yeeaah. The fuselage fairings. Alright, I'll see what I can do.
nice, thank you :]

Update

Before everything else, I add the very long ago request. KW stretchies. Here they are:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

5 tanks white, 1 Black. I ain't being racist here.

Edit: They have issues due to mapping. Ill get it fixed soon

Edited March 18, 2014 by blackheart612
The sides look great, but the ends not so much, how about ends like the very thin grey tanks? I think that might look better.
Hmm? You can try giving me a pic or explaining it better? Though I am really busy with a development. This is will get almost no attention, I believe.
Like the one on the left, might look better then then painted on tank dome.
Welp, yeah, thought about that. I'll change that some time. BTW, the issue about the bad shadow of some textures might be caused by reduced textures of Texture Management as I have found out I think.
Welp, I said this was the final version, but if you start painting ends like that I'll do a quick fix to allow normal maps for tank top/bottom...
Really? That's cool! I'd really appreciate that, man.
Can I make a request for this? Can the procedural fairings get an option to display the logo on them, like some of the SLS parts and the pods can?

Blackheart... You did some pretty nice KW style procedural fairings.. And now when FAR shielding is out for DR, I thought the obvious thing to do was a heat tiled procedural fairing. I just borrowed a texture from a roof tile company, downloaded the normal map plugin for PS, and had a little go at it.

Unfortunately it didn't look good enough to share. When I squinted and ignored the seams, and the way the normal map just became super low res as it stretched over the dome.. It still looked awesome. As I don't like squinting when I play, I thought if this maybe would be suitable as a request for you to do, if you ever had time spare? Cheers

So I tried out your Stretchy Tank addon textures, and only installed the KW & Stock ones since that's all that I use right now. When I go to cycle through the tank textures, after I cycle through the normal textures, the next half dozen choices are never loaded, instead getting stuck on the last Stretchy-SRB texture until it gets back to the beginning of the cycle. Seems like it's expecting your textures but they're not being loaded at all. I dropped them into the /GameData/blackheart/ directory.

Can I make a request for this? Can the procedural fairings get an option to display the logo on them, like some of the SLS parts and the pods can?

Well, I don't know how that works as of yet. Sorry I replied late.

Blackheart... You did some pretty nice KW style procedural fairings.. And now when FAR shielding is out for DR, I thought the obvious thing to do was a heat tiled procedural fairing. I just borrowed a texture from a roof tile company, downloaded the normal map plugin for PS, and had a little go at it.

Unfortunately it didn't look good enough to share. When I squinted and ignored the seams, and the way the normal map just became super low res as it stretched over the dome.. It still looked awesome. As I don't like squinting when I play, I thought if this maybe would be suitable as a request for you to do, if you ever had time spare? Cheers

Ahh, yeah, maybe. When I have spare time is the correct time...

So I tried out your Stretchy Tank addon textures, and only installed the KW & Stock ones since that's all that I use right now. When I go to cycle through the tank textures, after I cycle through the normal textures, the next half dozen choices are never loaded, instead getting stuck on the last Stretchy-SRB texture until it gets back to the beginning of the cycle. Seems like it's expecting your textures but they're not being loaded at all. I dropped them into the /GameData/blackheart/ directory.

It's caused by a missing texture, from where is stops, it means the next texture from it is not loaded, can you check that? It's easy, the folder integration is by Name so the next texture is either the next texture name in the folder or the next folder's texture (I hope you understand that)

So guys, I'm pretty sad to say that I am temporarily putting this on hold as to be able to hopefully release my dev mods (I got 2 active at the moment and gonna put another on hold) Thank you for your consideration.
Sorry blackheart if this has been asked before, but how do I add your textures to StretchySRB with its new layout? Do I have to copy every texture into the new cfg?

Well, I don't know how that works as of yet. Sorry I replied late.

'tis fine - it may well be beyond the capabilities of your re-textures and require modifications to Procedural Fairings itself, the more I think about it.

Thank you for your work on this, and I will be anxious to see your work elsewhere. (I'll probably end up using those, too.)

Sorry blackheart if this has been asked before, but how do I add your textures to StretchySRB with its new layout? Do I have to copy every texture into the new cfg?

New Stretchy SRB layout?
